tiDML 0.0.0.9000

package-replication

package-replication.Rmd
library(tiDML)
# Get 401k data from DoubleML package
library(DoubleML)
df <- DoubleML::fetch_401k(return_type = "data.frame", instrument = TRUE)

# run tiDML with random forest defaults
set.seed(401)
fit <- dml_plr(
  df = df,
  y = "net_tfa",
  d = "e401",
  x = c("age", "inc", "educ", "fsize", "marr", "twoearn", "db", "pira", "hown"),
  m_model = "rf",
  g_model = "rf"
)
#> [1] "base_recipe outcome_name: e401"
#> [1] "base_recipe predictors_chr: age, inc, educ, fsize, marr, twoearn, db, pira, hown"
#> [1] "base_recipe colnames: net_tfa, age, inc, educ, fsize, marr, twoearn, db, pira, hown, p401, e401, .row_id"
#> [1] "base_recipe outcome_name: net_tfa"
#> [1] "base_recipe predictors_chr: age, inc, educ, fsize, marr, twoearn, db, pira, hown"
#> [1] "base_recipe colnames: net_tfa, age, inc, educ, fsize, marr, twoearn, db, pira, hown, p401, e401, .row_id"
